text:
PRITHVI RAJ SINGH
OBEROI: I travel a lot.

He encouraged me to travel and
see hotels around the world.

And I traveled to every
country practically,
even South America, Rio.
Buenos Aires, I didn't go.

All over Europe, I didn't
go to China and Russia.

But otherwise, I've traveled
all over the world practically.

And seen many, many
hotels-- new and old.

And learned a lot, talked
to various people--
owners, managers.
That taught me a lot.

I think hotel industries, like
most, it's not that simple.

The main thing, I
think, is people.

Many people ask me, what
is your biggest asset?
And I say, our people.

And I think our guests
appreciate the quality
of service we give them.

And services, to me,
is not only providing

a meal quickly, or a
cup of coffee quickly,
or a drink quickly.

I think service is how you
treat the people, your guests.
We have to be polite.
You have to be gracious.

And I think that is something
that, in are company,
I think everybody understands.

That is what we've
concentrated on.

It's not that the physical
attributes aren't important.

But my father used to say you
can make a hotel out of gold--
I've quoted this many times--
solid gold.

And nobody will come if you
don't give proper service.
